common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after update, getting stuck on dependency checks. This affects Windows and MacOS.  Additionally, users experience difficulty linking Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously, with one account unlinking when the other is added. Proposed solutions include reinstalling, using a different installer build, waiting for new auth system, and providing user logs for debugging.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (`johnkennyuk`) encountering issues linking their GitHub and Google accounts.
* Old account linking flow identified as not ideal & being replaced in February.
* A merge of the two accounts proposed through various attempts with email verification and sign-in/out steps.
* Persistence of the issue leads to user waiting for the new system instead.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is dysfunctional and a replacement is underway.
* Potentially conflicting capitalization differences in user's emails were suspected.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Proposed merging accounts: user's Google (with custom domain) as main and keeping username for signing-in via GitHub.
* Temporary Google email privacy disable suggested for testing compatibility.
* Issue acknowledged as persistent & attributed to the existing and soon to be replaced auth service.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Account linking attempted repeatedly but ultimately unsuccessful with the existing system due to possible caps sensitivity.
* User opted to pause further attempts and await the implementation of the new auth system at the end of February for a potential fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation showcased good customer support by the Pieces representative, although the existing limitations prevented a resolution at this time.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* The user, JasonDWilson, is experiencing problems with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.
* The Pieces-support-bot automatically routed the issue to the relevant team member.
* The user is directed to related issues and helpful resources.
* Another team member, mark-at-pieces, provides a link to a similar issue and recommends debugging steps.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User is directed to:
    * Related issues on GitHub
    * Documentation
    * YouTube channel
    * Debugging steps in a specific issue
* Team member offers a call to assist with further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The original issue is closed.
* User is expected to follow the recommended debugging steps and contact the team member if needed. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation occurred on February 5, 2025.
* The issue may be related to another known problem being tracked in another ticket.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding PiecesOS Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Migration Issues:** The upgrade to PiecesOS 11.1.0 involves a major data migration, which can take a few minutes for users with large amounts of data.
* **Potential Issues with the `appInstaller` Build:** Users are encouraged to try the `appInstaller` build instead of the regular exe installer.
* **Elevated Issue Severity:** The PiecesOS team is actively investigating the issue due to its widespread occurrence.
* **User Logs:** Users are encouraged to provide their user logs to help with troubleshooting. 
* **Specific Issues:** 
    * Shamas Habib: Encountered an issue with PiecesOS not showing up in the tray or starting up on Windows.
    * Shamas Habib: Reinstalling Windows and PiecesOS multiple times did not resolve the issue.
    * JasonDWilson: Observed a longer than expected migration time and missing `support` directory in the install location.
    * rogierlegit: Encountered the same issue on MacOS Monterey, with PiecesOS getting stuck on the 'dependencies scenario' tab.
    * Other users: Reported similar issues with PiecesOS not starting up or getting stuck.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Slow Migration:** The migration process for large amounts of data can take longer than expected, causing delays for users.
* **Incomplete Installation:** Some users reported missing files or directories in their installation, potentially causing issues with startup.
* **General Startup Issues:** PiecesOS getting stuck on certain stages or not appearing in the tray across different operating systems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **`appInstaller` Build:** Offering an alternative installer build to address potential issues with the regular exe installer.
* **Increased Issue Severity:** Prioritizing the resolution of this issue due to its impact on multiple users.
* **Restarting PiecesOS for Developers Desktop Application:** A temporary solution to resolve the issue until a permanent fix is implemented.
* **Providing User Logs:** Enabling the PiecesOS team to diagnose the root cause of individual issues.
* **Updating to PiecesOS 11.1.1:** A new build addressing the reported issues was released on February 7, 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new build (11.1.1) released on February 7, 2025 appears to have resolved the issue for most users, including Shamas Habib.
* However, rogierlegit reported that the issue persists on MacOS Monterey.
* The PiecesOS team is actively investigating and working on a permanent fix for all platforms.

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary focuses on the most recent conversation regarding the issue and might not cover all details discussed earlier.
* Users are encouraged to keep providing feedback and logs to help the PiecesOS team resolve the remaining issues.

common_issues.title: Ollama Download and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties downloading and installing Ollama across Windows, Linux, and MacOS.  This is caused by various factors including sandbox restrictions, missing dependencies, and data migration issues during Pieces OS updates.  Proposed solutions involve updating Pieces OS to the latest version (11.1.1), using the 'appInstaller' build, and providing user logs for further investigation.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Installation Issue
**Key Points:**
* Surya-sengupta reported an issue with Ollama installation on Feb 2nd, 2025.
* The issue was automatically triaged and the user was informed of the estimated response time.
* Brian-at-pieces suggested updating to Pieces OS v11.1.0 for potential stability improvements.

**Problems Identified:**
* Ollama installation failed.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Update to Pieces OS v11.1.0.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* User is advised to update and retry the download. 
* No further information available to determine the final outcome.

**Additional Notes:**
* The user was provided with helpful resources like existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

**Overall:**
The issue appears to be related to Ollama installation. Brian-at-pieces suggests a potential solution, but further updates are needed to confirm the outcome.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
##  Summary of GitHub Issue: Ollama Download Failure in Pieces

**Key points raised:**

* Ollama download fails when using Pieces installed as a Snap package on Ubuntu.
* This is due to the sandboxed environment of Snap, which lacks access to curl and prevents Ollama from launching.

**Problems identified:**

* Miscommunication within the Pieces team about the confinement level of the Snap package.
* Lack of curl in the Snap package's dependencies.
* Inability to use Ollama installed outside the sandbox.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Adding curl to the Snap package's dependencies.
* Enabling Pieces to use Ollama from within the sandbox.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix is under development and expected to be released soon.
* Users are unable to download or use Ollama with Pieces until the fix is implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* Users are encouraged to manually download Ollama and launch it from the terminal as a workaround.
* This issue impacts both downloading and inferencing with Ollama. 
* Users are waiting for a resolution to avoid sharing their data with cloud-based LLMs.

    * JasonDWilson: Observed a longer than expected migration time and missing `support` directory in the install location.
    * rogierlegit: Encountered the same issue on MacOS Monterey, with PiecesOS getting stuck on the 'dependencies scenario' tab.
    * Other users: Reported similar issues with PiecesOS not starting up or getting stuck.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Slow Migration:** The migration process for large amounts of data can take longer than expected, causing delays for users.

* **General Startup Issues:** PiecesOS getting stuck on certain stages or not appearing in the tray across different operating systems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **`appInstaller` Build:** Offering an alternative installer build to address potential issues with the regular exe installer.

* However, rogierlegit reported that the issue persists on MacOS Monterey.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users are encouraged to keep providing feedback and logs to help the PiecesOS team resolve the remaining issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or getting stuck during startup after updating, particularly to version 11.1.0. This is likely due to a lengthy data migration process or incomplete installation. Proposed solutions include using the 'appInstaller' build, restarting the application, providing user logs, and updating to the latest version (11.1.1 as of February 7, 2025).

related_issues.title: i got this error when opening localhost
related_issues.text:
i got this error when opening localhost
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## GitHub Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 reported an issue with PiecesOS or the desktop app.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* Pieces is hosted on port 39300 and not on 1000 and 3000.

**Problems identified:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 was unable to open PiecesOS or the desktop app.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team will investigate the issue.
* @mark-at-pieces clarified the port number used by Pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being investigated by the Pieces team.
* @WhyQwerty23811 is awaiting a follow-up.

**Additional Information:**

* The conversation suggests that the issue may be related to the port number used by Pieces.
* The user is encouraged to consult the provided resources for further assistance.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Migration Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with PiecesOS, including slow migration times, startup failures, and missing files after upgrading to version 11.1.0.  Proposed solutions included using the `appInstaller` build, restarting the PiecesOS for Developers Desktop Application, and providing user logs for debugging. A new build (11.1.1) was released on February 7, 2025, which resolved the issue for some users.

related_issues.title: Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
related_issues.text:
Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
### Software

Release Notes (code.pieces.app/updates)

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

win 10

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

pieces for developers .....need out in french ,,,,,, where ???
## GitHub Issue Summary: Localization Feature Request

**Key Points:**

* User @CryptoIngenieur1 requested localizing Pieces app(s).
* Support bot acknowledged the issue and provided resources.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the team is researching localization but doesn't have a timeline.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces currently lacks support for localization.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Research into localization is ongoing.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No concrete timeline for implementing localization is available.
* The team is actively researching and will update the issue as progress is made.

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding PiecesOS Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Migration Issues:** The upgrade to PiecesOS 11.1.0 involves a major data migration, which can take a few minutes for users with large amounts of data.
* **Potential Issues with the `appInstaller` Build:** Users are encouraged to try the `appInstaller` build instead of the regular exe installer.
* **Elevated Issue Severity:** The PiecesOS team is actively investigating the issue due to its widespread occurrence.
* **User Logs:** Users are encouraged to provide their user logs to help with troubleshooting. 
* **Specific Issues:** 
    * Shamas Habib: Encountered an issue with PiecesOS not showing up in the tray or starting up on Windows.
    * Shamas Habib: Reinstalling Windows and PiecesOS multiple times did not resolve the issue.
    * JasonDWilson: Observed a longer than expected migration time and missing `support` directory in the install location.
    * rogierlegit: Encountered the same issue on MacOS Monterey, with PiecesOS getting stuck on the 'dependencies scenario' tab.
    * Other users: Reported similar issues with PiecesOS not starting up or getting stuck.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Slow Migration:** The migration process for large amounts of data can take longer than expected, causing delays for users.
* **Incomplete Installation:** Some users reported missing files or directories in their installation, potentially causing issues with startup.
* **General Startup Issues:** PiecesOS getting stuck on certain stages or not appearing in the tray across different operating systems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **`appInstaller` Build:** Offering an alternative installer build to address potential issues with the regular exe installer.
* **Increased Issue Severity:** Prioritizing the resolution of this issue due to its impact on multiple users.
* **Restarting PiecesOS for Developers Desktop Application:** A temporary solution to resolve the issue until a permanent fix is implemented.
* **Providing User Logs:** Enabling the PiecesOS team to diagnose the root cause of individual issues.
* **Updating to PiecesOS 11.1.1:** A new build addressing the reported issues was released on February 7, 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new build (11.1.1) released on February 7, 2025 appears to have resolved the issue for most users, including Shamas Habib.
* However, rogierlegit reported that the issue persists on MacOS Monterey.
* The PiecesOS team is actively investigating and working on a permanent fix for all platforms.

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary focuses on the most recent conversation regarding the issue and might not cover all details discussed earlier.
* Users are encouraged to keep providing feedback and logs to help the PiecesOS team resolve the remaining issues.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* The user, JasonDWilson, is experiencing problems with the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.
* The Pieces-support-bot automatically routed the issue to the relevant team member.
* The user is directed to related issues and helpful resources.
* Another team member, mark-at-pieces, provides a link to a similar issue and recommends debugging steps.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop Version.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User is directed to:
    * Related issues on GitHub
    * Documentation
    * YouTube channel
    * Debugging steps in a specific issue
* Team member offers a call to assist with further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The original issue is closed.
* User is expected to follow the recommended debugging steps and contact the team member if needed. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation occurred on February 5, 2025.
* The issue may be related to another known problem being tracked in another ticket.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize PiecesOS Startup Issues:** Focus on resolving the widespread issue of PiecesOS failing to launch after the 11.1.0 update, particularly the persistent problems on MacOS. Investigate data migration processes and installer inconsistencies.

**Improve Ollama Download and Installation:** Address the difficulties users face when downloading and installing Ollama, including sandbox restrictions and dependency conflicts. Provide clearer instructions or automated solutions.

**Investigate Account Linking Issues:** Address the persistent problem of users being unable to link both Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Prioritize the rollout of the new authentication system and ensure it resolves this issue.

**Monitor PiecesOS 11.1.1 Adoption:** Encourage users to update to the latest version and monitor its effectiveness in resolving the reported startup and migration issues. Gather feedback from users still experiencing problems.

**Improve Communication and Documentation:** Provide clear and concise communication to users regarding known issues, workarounds, and expected resolution times. Update documentation with troubleshooting steps for common problems like Ollama installation and account linking.

**Review User Logs Proactively:** Implement a system to proactively review user logs for common error messages and patterns. This will help identify and address emerging issues before they become widespread.

**Consider a Dedicated FAQ for PiecesOS:** Create a dedicated FAQ section on the Pieces website specifically for PiecesOS-related issues. Include answers to common questions, troubleshooting steps, and known issue workarounds.

**Gather User Feedback on Localization:** Given the interest in French localization, consider conducting a survey or gathering feedback on other desired languages. This will help prioritize future localization efforts.
